Large tree on green in Embleton Road has dropped all its leaves. These have become slippery and narrowed the pavement for walkers, buggies etc. along a stretch of around 10 metres. Please could we have this pavement swept now all leaves have fallen - it has been a problem for a couple of months. Thank you.

Mass of wet leaves: A mass of wet leaves, twigs and discarded rubbish in Waterbank Road, some of which are blocking a drain. Please can we have our road swept. Several residents (pensioners) sweep up the leaves, but we do not all have garden bins, where do we put them? Why should we do Lewisham's work for them and pay £80 for a garden bin? Watermead and Allerford roads have been swept several times over the past few weeks. Waterbank would like to have the same service please. The leaves come off trees PLANTED BY LEWISHAM COUNCIL in the pavements in years gone by. It is the responsibility of Lewisham Council to attend to these trees. I would welcome the opportunity of a phone call from Lewisham to discuss the matter please.

description:
Car parked on corner / double yellow: It has been parked here for 3 days. Preventing pedestrian use of corner as well as making driving difficult.

My original report (4060987) was closed and Lewisham Council requested 'registration number of vehicle'. Fixmystreets report page says 'Avoid personal information and vehicle number plates'.

I do not believe the issue should not have been closed or registration number requested.

title: Noisy metal cover
detail:
This has been reported twice before and after 6 months it's still not fixed. It's disturbing my sleep and it's not something my doctor cannot help me with, it's not fair, it needs to be fixed.

The metals covers were installed a couple of years when they dug the road up to install electrical cables. They are located in the road near to the dropped kerb outside number 34 Senlac Road. The cover nearest to the centre of the road makes a noise when vehicles drive over it, this noise disturbs our sleep, we have tried to live with it but cannot no longer. Please get it fixed so we can get some sleep. Please do not mark this problem as fixed when nothing has been done about it. If this needs to go to a contractor please state which one and give a reference number.

Rubbish clearing problem: The area outside New Cross Pharmacy (covid clinic) is constantly filthy with rubbish. This would not be left like this in an affluent area so why is it acceptable in New Cross? It is always like this. Is this area outside scope for cleaning? Please advise when rubbish will be removed, road swept and if this can be scheduled more regularly - as it’s not happening at the moment. Thank you.

title: TfL says this is LBL to resolve : Shelter at bus stop X Cambridge Drive towards Lewisham : shelter roof lighting not working
detail:
TfL says this is LBL to resolve : Shelter at bus stop X Cambridge Drive towards Lewisham : shelter roof lighting not working

Reported to TfL as reference FMS 3876536 07/10/22.

TfL has now closed the report saying "Our team had investigated this for you and found that this doesn't fall under the responsibility of Transport for London and comes under the remit of the local borough."

This shelter has been in darkness since February 2022 despite various reports to them each time.

LBL please pursue this and I am annoyed to be pushed between owners of the problem so please annotate that you either own this or have resolved directly with TfL who is going to fix the problem,. The shelter has a TfL ref number on it as you can see from the photographs and not a JC Decaux signage.

For avoidance of doubt it is this shelter:

Https://www.instantstreetview.com/@51.455179,0.017034,147.55h,0.32p,2.72z,J90pp1qTXG-_5OQv1YTxFw

Thank you

detail: All the trees in Aylward are badly overgrown from the base the the crown, they never used to be like this years ago, So i can only conclude that they are not being managed correctly, they need to be sorted out asap they are a big problem not only to the people who live in the road but also the people who are forced into the road because the trees are over grown all the way up the trunk from the ground to the crown, Also our road is being used as a rubbish tip because the trees conceal the rubbish being planted in them

Dangerous fence at Nesbit Close: There is a very dangerous wobbly fence on top of a large hill. The fence moves and is very close to homes below the hill. Non residents use the space in the fence as a short cut which damages the fence more making the gap bigger and wobbly. I originally reported this incident on 7th February 2022 to James however nothing has been done unfortunately and the fence continues to get weaker. The fence is now leaning back and is only a matter of time before it falls completely. Please can you advise. Many thanks

title: Waste collection done wrong. Again.
detail:
Nothing new here, just the usual crew coming to collect the rubbish and leaving all the bins out of their stores.

I’m pretty sure they are supposed to put them back by contract, am I wrong?

This has been going on for more than a year and I’ve submitted multiple reports..does anyone care?!

Massively overgrown weeds the length of Sprules Road: The pavements and curbs along the length of Sprules Road (on both sides) have been covered in weeds for the last 18 months. In summer 2021 residents spent over 20 hours de-weeding large stretches of the road by hand, and we have just spent more than this again and barely made a dent on the Vesta Road and Drakefell Road ends. The weeds are a tripping hazard for people unsteady on their feet, but they are also unsightly and perhaps that untidiness, and apparent lack of care for our surroundings, contributes to passersby feeling they can litter and fly tip along the length of the road. Finally, soil seems to accumulate where the road surface meets the curbside, and that again provides much food for new crops of weeds to sprout. We could dearly benefit from the council both weeding the pavements and cleaning the road.

detail: Hi there, apologies in advance if this type of report does not qualify for this channel. I'm not even sure if Lewisham deals with these types of issues (I've read that some councils do). Property 124, has a few untidy areas that need sorting. I've already reported fly-tipping at the front and here I'm reporting (1) an untidy terrace straight outside our bedroom window; and (2) an abandoned garden with blackberry aggressively spreading and overspilling into other properties/gardens. Again, apologies if this is not the right place to report such an issue. I do hope there's a chance that Lewisham council could encourage the owners to tidy up those areas. Thank you

description:
Graffiti: My recent report on graffiti on buildings and shutters was responded to by Lewisham Council in that if I notified them of a particular building they would try to include that in their programe for cleaning due to not enough funding or staff to take on any large scale cleaning to clear it. It surely needs someone from LBC to look at the state of the High Street and come up with something more positive to clear the problem.

What's happened to the CCTV cameras in the High Street. I'm sure the shop keepers can offer some help, it can't do their business much good trading in such a messy Street. The police must know the tags and the names/addresses of the people causing the damage Shops should not be allowed to sell spray paint or marker pens to under 21's.

title: Graffiti

detail: Last year a brick pillar on the western corner of St Margaret's Square fell down - perhaps it was hit by a vehicle. Someone has moved it from the middle of the pavement and into the hedge, which is nice, but the smashed up brickwork remains on its side. It's unsightly and needs rebuilding in line with the rules for the conservation area.

description:
Bridge over the River Quaggy: The bridge over the River Quaggy is on the boundary of Bromley and Greenwich with Bromley being the highway authority for the bridge and to the east of the bridge. West of the bridge Lewisham is the highway authority, and north of the bridge Greenwich is the highway authority.

Shown in the picture is the shiny new 10T weight restriction sign installed at Bromley taxpayers' expense to the east of the bridge. There are no weight restriction signs to the north of the bridge (Greenwich) or to the west of the bridge (Lewisham).

Lewisham assert that the bridge now has a 40T weight limit (presumably believing it has been strengthened) and they gleaned this information from Bromley.

Either Bromley has squandered taxpayers' money on the new sign or Lewisham has made a mistake in removing the 10T limit signs.

To further confuse matters, there is a second bridge over the River Quaggy this time on Mottingham Lane, again on the boundary of Bromley and Greenwich, but with Greenwich the highway authority. Could it be that this bridge has the 10T limit.

Whatever the answer, this matter needs investigating as a matter of urgency, and the investigation should include liaising with Lewisham and Greenwich highway authorities to get to the bottom of this matter and ensuring that all three highway authorities display the correct signage for the bridge.
title: Bridge over the River Quaggy
detail:

Lewisham assert that the bridge now has a 40T weight limit (presumably believing it has been strengthened) and they gleaned this information from Bromley.

Whatever the answer, this matter needs investigating as a matter of urgency, and the investigation should include liaising with Lewisham and Greenwich highway authorities to get to the bottom of this matter and ensuring that all three highway authorities display the correct signage for the bridge.

description: Fence already pulled down by gate onto public pavement but now is also pulled entirely away at the other end by the railway. Rubbish being thrown on to Site of Importance for Nature Conservation via this massive hole.: The sections of pulled down fence are huge now and various issues as a result - people can get on to the land and damage/vandalise the scout hut & SINC site all listed with Lewisham as assets of community value. Rubbish being dumped on the site and pathway obstructed with fencing.

title: Fence already pulled down by gate onto public pavement but now is also pulled entirely away at the other end by the railway. Rubbish being thrown on to Site of Importance for Nature Conservation via this massive hole.

Pothole: This pothole has been here for AGES. I reported a long time ago and it’s still not been fixed. It’s actually gotten bigger since I first reporter it and appears to be sinking. It sits next to what appears to be a water mains supply stopcock on the walkway in front of Lewisham Park Towers. It’s close to the front of the Kemsley block building.
